cells.reasonOutOfScope: Client can use any FIX client they want

threats.title: Spoofing FIX messages (one client pretending to be another client).
threats.mitigation:
Dedicated leased line between customer and FIX gateway (only selected users).
Perform authentication and authorization of client before performing any sensitive operation.
Password strength will be defined and enforced by marketgrid.
Authorization checks to be provided?
threats.description: A client sending spoof messages (such as placing a malicious order to FIX gateway) on behalf of another client. Sensitive operations such as PlaceOrder, CancelOrder, ExecutionReport,etc should be validated before execution.

threats.title: The channel is not encrypted hence man in the middle attack possible
threats.mitigation: dedicated leased line between client and ANX
threats.description: since the channel is not encrypted an attacker can be in the middle of the connection between client and ANX and can modify messages sent between the two parties.

threats.title: Repudiation of messages - Actor denying messages sent by them
threats.description: repudiation - for example client placing an order but denying that the order was placed.
threats.mitigation:
authentication between client an FIX gateway before any sensitive operation occur
Peform logging on the FIX gateway for all client acitvities.

threats.title: Information disclosure about the system and other clients
threats.description: Information disclosure can be through variety of methods such as unrestricted API, debugging message, etc. In this case information disclosure can be through malformed FIX messages.
threats.mitigation: Message validation and authorization checks should be done wherever applicable. for example: one client asking for order details of another client.

threats.title: Client sending large number of traffic to the FIX gateway
threats.mitigation:
FIX gateway - not opened to the internet.
Loadbalancer to reduce impact to DoS
Firewall to filter traffic.
FIX gateway to implement some throttling mechanism of messages.
threats.description: client sending large amount of traffic to the FIX gateway so ANX cannt process legitimate request

threats.title: Client can elevate privileges on the FIX gateway.
threats.mitigation: FIX gateway admin interface is restricted to internal ANX network

threats.title: Spoofing of messages sent from FIX gateway to Market Grid
threats.description: rogue system can send rogue messages to market grid pretending to be FIX gateway and place an order.
threats.mitigation: FIX gateway and MG engine is designed to be in a segregated subnet and only allowed to talk to each other.

threats.title: Tampering of data in transit
threats.description: Man in the middle attack between FIX gateway and market grid
threats.mitigation:
Use Encrypted channel such as HTTPS (not implemented).
IP level filtering has been done so only FIX gateway can talk with market grid.

threats.title: Information disclosure of sensitive information
threats.description: Information disclosure can be through variety of methods such as unrestricted API, debugging message. In this case information disclosure can be through unauthenticated APIs. Ensure all APIs performing sensitive functions are authenticated.
threats.mitigation: FIX gateway and MG are placed in a segregated subnet and only allowed to talk to each other. ZeroMQs listeners are not exposed to the rest of the network.

threats.title: repudiation - messages sent from FIX gateway should have integrity check whether it has been sent from FIX gateway
threats.description: For example: Rogue user sent rogue message (Put an order) to the market to Market Grid via ZeroMQ
threats.mitigation: FIX gateway and MG are placed in a segregated subnet and only allowed to talk to each other.

threats.title: Spoofing of messages from MG to Engine service and vice versa.
threats.description: rogue system can send rogue messages (such as place an order) to Engine service pretending to be market grid.
threats.mitigation:
Use authentication checks before any sensitive operations.
MG and Trading Service/Engine service are placed in a segregated enviornment.

threats.title: Tampering of data between MG and Engine service
threats.description: If a cleartext protocol is used any system who has access to the network can listen to the data in transit.

threats.title: Information disclosure
threats.mitigation:
Ensure all listeners, publishers performing sensitive functions are authenticated.
MG and engine service are in a segregated subnet and not exposed to the internal networks.
threats.description: Information disclosure can be through variety of methods such as unrestricted API, debugging message. In this instance information disclosure can be through unauthenticated MQ listeners/publishers .
